remarks: Given a lattice line on a lattice plane, there is an atom whose join with the line equals the plane.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Jun-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lplnexat.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
lplnexat.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
lplnexat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
lplnexat.n $e |- N = ( LLines ` K ) $.
lplnexat.p $e |- P = ( LPlanes ` K ) $.
lplnexatN $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. P /\ Y e. N ) /\ Y .<_ X ) -> E. q e. A ( -. q .<_ Y /\ X = ( Y .\/ q ) ) ) $.
$d .<_ q $.
$d A q $.
$d K q $.
$d X q $.
$d Y q $.
